metadata.dc:description: Aortic dissection is a potentially lethal disease whose incidence in pregnant women can be up to 100 times that of the remaining adult population. In most cases, it presents as typical chest pain. We report the case of a 37yo obese woman diagnosed with chronic type A aortic dissection documented by a radiological finding 10 months after delivery.
metadata.dc:subject: Disección aórtica
Preeclampsia
Aorta
Aortic dissection
metadata.dc:title: Disección aórtica crónica tipo A en un paciente con obesidad mórbida y preeclampsia.
Type A chronic aortic dissection with obesity and preeclampsia.
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista espanola de anestesiologia y reanimacion
